page.title: 12FARMING: CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: In Cherry Willingham and Reepham there are two farms although we are in an area dominated by farm land. The land is mostly arable with just three or four fields containing cattle (usually Lincoln Reds). We have over a period of time a large number of crops but rape seed, wheat, barley and potatoes are the major crops. This year there are a number of fields which contain peas. Like many other farms in the county the land is very intensively farmed and it is not uncommon to see the workers doing night shifts especially during ploughing and harvesting seasons. In our survey we noticed that about 10% of the field hedges no longer exist and there is a large programme of crop spraying. S.PROCTOR
